org.wso2.carbon.identity.oauth2.token.handlers.grant.saml

Class SAML2BearerGrantHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wso2.carbon.identity.oauth2.token.handlers.grant.AbstractAuthorizationGrantHandler
      • org.wso2.carbon.identity.oauth2.token.handlers.grant.saml.SAML2BearerGrantHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AuthorizationGrantHandler

    public class SAML2BearerGrantHandler
extends AbstractAuthorizationGrantHandler
    This implements SAML 2.0 Bearer Assertion Profile for OAuth 2.0 - http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-saml2-bearer-14.

      • validateGrant

        public boolean validateGrant(OAuthTokenReqMessageContext tokReqMsgCtx)
                      throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        We're validating the SAML token that we receive from the request. Through the assertion parameter in the POST request. A request format that we handle here looks like,

        POST /token.oauth2 HTTP/1.1 Host: as.example.com Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

        grant_type=urn%3Aietf%3Aparams%3Aoauth%3Agrant-type%3Asaml2-bearer& assertion=PHNhbWxwOl...[omitted for brevity]...ZT4

        Specified by:
        validateGrant in interface AuthorizationGrantHandler
        Overrides:
        validateGrant in class AbstractAuthorizationGrantHandler
        Parameters:
        tokReqMsgCtx - Token message request context
        Returns:
        true if validation is successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IdentityOAuth2Exception

      • issueRefreshToken

        public boolean issueRefreshToken()
                          throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        Description copied from interface: AuthorizationGrantHandler
        Tells if this grant type could issue refresh tokens.
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • createLegacyUser

        protected void createLegacyUser(OAuthTokenReqMessageContext tokReqMsgCtx,
                                org.opensaml.saml2.core.Assertion assertion)
                         throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        This method is setting the username removing the domain name without checking whether the user is federated or not. This fix has done for support backward capability.
        Parameters:
        tokReqMsgCtx - Token request message context.
        assertion - SAML2 Assertion.
        Throws:
        IdentityOAuth2Exception
